Reviews.Content: My husband just past away around 3 months ago and I had people trying to steal his tools and things but with this product I put it out and its small where it is not so noticeable  and if anyone trys to come across it either by car or walking it sets of a alarm in the house and lets me someone is messing around outside... I am going to get a few more and put them in different areas  for extra safty, Plus it has a really good price and the alarm that goes off is loud enough to hear it though the whole house.....

Reviews.Title: FYI - I have over 20 of these - Excellent Units
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to post a review/comment because I see people making reviews and comments that are rediculous. These units are an excellent low cost security motion sensor unit.I use these in the mountains and most are there 6 months out of the year and they endure all the weather the mountains can throw at them. To this day I have never had one gliche yet and some of mine are over 3 years old. Battery life with them is also excellent.You need to pay attention to the product information, the motion sensor is NOT water proof, they are weather resistant. that means DONT put them where they will get soaked or filled with rain or water....DUH...Also, people mention that it will continue to chime or alarm, the sensor has a wide angle fresnal lense, that means it will pick up motion in a very wide area horozontally and vertically. Also, they are heat sensitive, so if it is in direct sun light or where it will see moving shadows from the sun it will trigger the motion sensor. It will trigger from motion and heat, a small tree branch moving to a butterfly flying across in front of the sensor can and will trigger it.Here is a tip, you can cut down the amount of area the motion sensor picks up by just putting a couple small strips of masking tape vertically along the edges of the motion sensor fresnal lense, you can also do this across the top and bottom of the lense to narrow the detection field vertically. Simple thinking and it works like a charm.To water proof a sensor, use some silicone around the outside of the sensor casing along the seam, then put a small bead of silicone around the outside edge of the fresnal lense. this will help protect it even more from wet weather. The best way to protect it is to place it under an eave or under some sort of cover so it doesnt get soaked. very simple.These units also come in different channels, so you can get many units using the same frequency. Place one chime/reciever where you want to hear it and then place as many of the sensors outdoors as you want, you will have extra chimes/receivers but who cares, for the price you cant beat these units.For the record, I would not buy any other type, these have served me well over the years and I will continue to use them as long as they continue to make them. An excellent product and I recommend them to anyone that is on a budget for security or would just like a low cost peice of mind for around there home or business.Ya gotta be smarter than the box they come in.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: E. M. Johnson "Occasional Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: This is the BEST INEXPENSIVE security device I have ever owned! It's now 8-25-12 and I have had two of these outside in the New England winter, spring, summer heat and pouring rain. If you have two sensors outside, either will sound both receivers- so it's hard to tell which area has movement. I don't see any way to get it to discriminate which zone is causing it to sound. This alarm works well and is well worth the $20 investment. There have been no failures of it working. It does pick up my next door neighbor pulling into his driveway about 50 feet away but that's ok. There have been a few instances when it went off repeatedly for no apparent reason. This seems to happen in full direct summer sun. But it does not happen consistently. There have been times I switched the receiver off (mowing the lawn and tripping it repeatedly annoys people indoors) and forgotten to turn it back on. So I recommend if you switch off the receiver, leave it on a counter top or somewhere you will see it and remember to switch it back on. So far I have not had to replace batteries either!A total two thumbs up.ORIGINAL REVIEWThey sell these locally at Harbor Freight stores, so if you live near one just drop in, they are $17.99 plus tax. I was having problems with my wireless doorbells working reliably so it occurred to me that one of these would cover both my front doors plus let me know when the mailman or UPS had been by. Also, from a security standpoint, hearing an alert when anyone was on the property approaching my front door was a big plus. For $20 I honestly didn't expect much.The sensor and receiver are nothing fancy but SURPRISE- they work perfectly! In fact, the sensor was TOO sensitive and was picking up cars going by in the street (about 20-25 feet away). I had to change the sensor position to facing across the property in front of the house instead of facing the street. So far it works flawlessly. It was been out in the bitter New England cold about a week. Give yourself a day or so to test it out before permanently fastening it in one location. That way you can be sure it is adequately covering the area you want it to without a lot of false alarms.I secured it to a railing on the front steps with two plastic locking cable ties. If you are worried about someone removing it, use a metal clamp from the plumbing section in Home Depot. It comes with two screws and a hole on the back of the sensor to mount it on a wall-- that didn't look very secure to me at all and it would be too easily removed. There is a small flashing red light on the front of the sensor that gos off when it "sees" you. If you like, cover it with tape to make it less visible especially at night). I bet you could hide one of these in a bird house or something like that if you really wanted to conceal it. It didn't try this though as its not necessary for me.The receiver is pretty loud on the high setting and can be heard through the house. It has a low and off setting too so you or whoever's in the house don't go insane if you are using a monitored area a lot for the day. (Just ask my teenager who was "trying to sleep" during my installation and testing phase on Saturday morning).I realize this unit is still new and has not been through any major rain or snow yet. I will return in a few months to update this review. I was happy enough to buy a second one to put on the back deck that has a glass sliding door. I read there is a way to get two sensors to sound on one receiver but I figure if I leave one set on high volume and the other on low volume, I will know which one is actually sensing something. I hope this helps you decide. Don't let the low price fool you, this thing really works!

Reviews.Author: Carlton O Phelps
Reviews.Content: This driveway alert works great. Has already worked for us when a person was trying to sneak up our drive way to check out our vehicles with robbery in mind. Worth every penny.

I had to place my 911 address sign blocking the left side of unit cause it was picking up semi trucks from the highway about 100' away. The inside unit has 2 settings high and low for the sound. I keep it on low cause the high is very loud.

Reviews.Author: Parl Guthrie
Reviews.Content: I bought two units and was so impressed three weeks later I went out to buy three more, but when I got to the store they didn't have channel #14.  I wanted to ensure that all the motion detectors were on the same channel so I could have only one beeper in the house and the others could be outside scaring the intruders away.  The store also had an upgraded model of the item and the upgrades didn't have the channel numbers writen on the box like the old ones did.  They need to let the customer know what he/she is getting and make it available for every channel.

Reviews.Title: driveway alarm

Reviews.Content: Now that we have it, don't know how we got along without it--have a driveway that is not too long, but it sure works well, so we are not taken by surprise when someone comes to the house.  Am going to get more for family members.

Reviews.Title: Worked well but failed after 7 months use; replacement didn't ever work
Reviews.Author: M. Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit on October 11, 2012 from Homesafe. I mounted it outside, under the roof of a carport and facing my driveway. The range seems to be only about 30 feet, which is far less than what was advertised but works great for me because it didn't respond to traffic on my street beyond the end of my driveway. That kept false alarms to a minimum; they only occurred a few times over a 7-month period (using the alarm perhaps 10 hours per week on average) when deer or ground squirrels walked within range of the sensor.The alarm on the receiver is plenty loud when set to the High setting (I can actually hear it sound when I'm on a different floor in my two-story house). The 9-volt battery for the outdoor unit (the transmitter and motion sensor) lasted for four months before it needed replacing, great performance considering this spanned the autumn and winter months in Central Oregon (where it regularly gets down to the teens and twenties and can get down to below zero on occasion during the winter). This leads me to conclude that the system is very efficient in its power usage.Unfortunately, the system stopped working a few days ago. I replaced the three C batteries for the receiver and the 9-volt battery for the motion sensor/transmitter, but the alarm still doesn't sound when I walk directly in front of the sensor. The LED for the motion sensor still lights when it detects motion, and the alarm still sounds when I turn the receiver on, so the sensor and speaker are evidently still good. I suspect the receiver's chip has died.Aside from the premature failure, this is a good unit that I would recommend to anyone who needs a driveway alarm with very limited sensor range. Other reviewers have noted better range, so manufacturing tolerances are evidently at work here, and your mileage may vary.Postscript: I ordered a replacement system by the same name ("Driveway Alert System") from True Power. What I received was slightly different from what I"d received before (same form factor, but different switch configuration), perhaps an updated version. It worked intermittently for 24 hours, after which time it consistently failed to work: The sensor's LED would light when a person or car crossed its beam path from only several feet away, but the alarm wouldn't sound even with the receiver only 40 feet away with a clear line of sight (no walls or windows obstructing the signal path) and no RF-producing equipment within at least 30 feet. To their credit, True Power sent a replacement without requiring me to return the defective unit.Postscript: The replacement system failed also. It worked twice, then consistently failed to trigger thereafter. I replaced batteries in both units, but that didn't help. Both sets of batteries for both sets of units -- transmitter and receiver --  were fresh/new EverReady Gold batteries with expiration dates in 2018. So I can categorically rule out that spent batteries are the problem. Also, once the system failed (after two successful alarms), it would not trigger no matter how close together I had the transmitter and receiver. Whether placed indoors or outdoors (far away from the house and from any potential RF; there is no above-ground telephone or electrical wiring on streets in my development), the two units would not trigger even when they were literally less than one foot away from each other and when walking directly in front of the sensor from less than two feet away (in all cases, the sensor's red LED would light, but the receiver wouldn't respond).Postscript 7/17/13: True Power refunded my money, including shipping, for the defective units. They maintained they could not get the returned units to fail in operation, so the units' failure on my end is a mystery (especially because I've since bought a different brand/model of driveway alarm, and it has consistently worked reliably from the start). True Power's customer service and communication were excellent. I would do business with them again.

Reviews.Title: alarm system

Reviews.Content: i'm sorry people,but i cannot get this item to work over 6 feet.i have tried new batteries,tried moving it to different positions,and it still does not work.the co, is great.i recd it ahead of schedule,and i'm sure they would replace it,but i think i will try a different brand. this item was bought from harbor freight & not amazon

Reviews.Title: Don't buy one
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for a few days,then started going off for no reason . I moved the sensor to a spot where it would not see anything and it still alarmed .It always worked when something went by it but went off when nothing went by,I fell like I was robbed!

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Ruth Hadley
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this item before buying it and the only negative comment was about it getting wet and not working afterwards. So my son cut an opening out of the side of an empty gallon milk jug and placed the unit in it with the top of the jug down. It keeps it out of the weather and any water that gets in during a storm will easily drain!! It also eliminates tree branches, leaves, etc. from setting off the chime needlessly!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: jt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit about a month ago.  For the first couple of days, the unit worked fine, and then it rained. The unit filled with water and stopped working.  I took the battery out and let the unit dry for a few days, and it did work again, briefly.  It stopped working again, and after checking, moisture again....would not recommend for outdoor use unless you have the unit encased in something to protect it from the elements.

Reviews.Title: Excellent alert system but watch how and where you mount it
Reviews.Author: SilverFox "SilverFox"
Reviews.Content: We needed this item because of our isolated location and few windows facing our driveway/main entrance.In our location, the sensor/transmitter is mounted about 100 feet from the receiver and fixed to a tree about belt high facing the driveway. At first, we had several false alarms because of one thing... the method they give you to mount the sensor/transmitter.  There is one key-hole mount located on the back/top of the sensor/transmitter that you are supposed to hang it from.  I suppose that may work for some locations but NOT where you have a chance of getting wind which causes the unit to move back and forth (even slightly).  This movement can cause it to think something is moving in front of it and it triggers.To solve the problem, at least for now, I pushed the unit between two vertical tree trunks.  This did not allow it to move and that's all it took.  Trigger accuracy improved significantly however, if you plan to face it toward bushes or other foliage, you may get false triggers on windy days,  I wish they had a sensitivity adjustment.As I mentioned tree or bush or even bird flight movement will set it off.  If the area you are monitoring has an abundance of these, you may get more false triggers than you want.  I accidentally spilled some parrot seeds/feed on my driveway and the birds, and this alarm, were very busy for awhile.I understand from other reviews that the Sun may cause false triggers so I faced ours North which will also save the sensor lens from UV deterioration over the years.I also previously purchased a car back-up camera from Amazon as well as a "Fake" security camera.  I installed the camera in the security camera enclosure, mounted  it on the garage and we tune our TV to this camera when this Driveway sensor alerts us.  Works Great!Make sure that, when you install your battery, you keep the rubber battery cover gasket in place as you close the lid or water penetration may be a problem.So far, so good!

Reviews.Title: alert review
Reviews.Author: fiddle
Reviews.Content: Easy setup and placement, but the maximum range was approximately 100 feet. This was not enough distance, so will have to purchase a high distance to be functional.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Mailman
Reviews.Content: Got four stars just barely because I do like it, but three stars might be more accurate. Possibly I do not have it set up in the optimum location to avoid quite a few false alarms. I had a more expensive alarm that lasted for years, but it was finicky too, so for about $18, what do we have to complain about? I will continue to adjust the position of the sensor. Wish it had a sensitivity adjustment. I also found an old power converter that works with it (it did not come with one) to save on batteries.

Reviews.Title: These do not work.
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these for my husband for Christmas and neither work properly. One quit working after about a day. Also they are "driveway" alerts but the directions say they cannot be outside in the elements.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work properly
Reviews.Author: S. Massey
Reviews.Content: this doesn't work properly, we are using it in our retail store to alert when customers come in, works about half the time. Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: too sensitive--
Reviews.Author: Tom Buchholzer
Reviews.Content: The transmitter has a VERY wide receiving area---I am using it as an alarm for my front door entrance, and it picks up anything that casts a shadow onto the transmitter; even the shadow of the flag on the front of the house---A LOT of false alarms from this source--

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert System I use in the house as alert for handicapped person
Reviews.Author: V. Christy "ArtistAtWork"
Reviews.Content: My brother is mentally challenged and I need to know when he goes into the bathroom so I can assist him do what he needs to do. It has an on and off on the control unit and a button to choose very loud or low. The low is plenty loud enough for my purposes. I have the detector mounted in front of the bathroom door. The control sits out in the great room where I can control it on or off. I can hear it anywhere in the house and it keeps me informed when my brother will need assistance when he goes to the bathroom.I don't use it as a driveway alert system, but it sure works great for my need inside the home. I like this because unlike other alarms that sound right at the detector this one the alarm is not at the door. I had one like that and my brother got so he wouldn't even go into the bathroom. This one does not scare or startle him because the alarm is way out in the great room letting me know he is going into the bathroom but not close to my brother to scare him with the chime.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Mr. Doc
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a month and have been pretty happy with how it works.  The range is great line-of-sight.  Once you get walls, etc. in the way, it decreases rapidly.  I have it probably a few hundred feet from the house with the receiver indoors on an outside wall and it works well.  I built a little shelter for the transmitter out of a plastic container to protect it from the elements.  I get very few, if any, false alarms.  It's gone off in the middle of the night rarely and I can't confirm if it's a false alarm or if there's an animal triggering it.  Snow fall doesn't bother it, yet it will trigger if a person or dog walks by (based on how low I have it).I'm happy with the volume options and love the new piece of mind of knowing when somebody is coming up to the house.  I'd give it 5 stars if it were even better re: range.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: banzilla
Reviews.Content: Driveway Alert SystemRecieved promptly, works as described, only option i wish it had was a size or weight sensor, so cats wouldnt set it off!

Reviews.Title: Not for distance
Reviews.Author: Jon Gee "zip"
Reviews.Content: Brought two units one for shop, the other for driveway. Shop unit works fine maybe 50 feet. Driveway unit 150 feet did not work well for long. 6 volt charge pin does not include charger. Note weather resistant not water proof.

Reviews.Title: Great and Terrible
Reviews.Author: Esther  Williams
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this 5 stars based on the performance from one of the sensors but the other one is so bad it is useless.  Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Really?
Reviews.Author: Eric E Polidoro
Reviews.Content: I purchased this driveway alert this past weekend. After installing it it took me about ten minutes to get the receiver to receive the signal from the transmitter. I thought I was done but two days later it started signaling an alert randomly. There was nothing in the area to tigger this signal as I checked multiple times. This went on for two days until I finally uninstalled it, reclaimed my batteries and placed it in the trash. Bad purchase.

Reviews.Title: First one did not work. Did not know how to return
Reviews.Author: vpar2000
Reviews.Content: Just works part of time. Have one a couple of years old that is still working and doing good, but last 2 I ordered were not good

Reviews.Title: Broke Fast
Reviews.Author: W. Land
Reviews.Content: It was great while it worked. We used it to alert us when someone was at the drive thru at our restaurant. It broke in about a month.

Reviews.Title: Will not last long.
Reviews.Author: J. Paccione "slider"
Reviews.Content: stopped working within a week. Not much quality in the electronics, but I should have expected that for only twenty bucks.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth
Reviews.Content: a bit sensitive but it works. my husband put it on a tree along our drive way. painted it black so it doesn't stand out to much. no sneaking up on us. lol

Reviews.Title: Ok product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This product is ok for what i paid for it, but unfortunatly it is overly sensitive to any cat or bird in the area.

Reviews.Title: good only 10 degrees from center
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: Works at range of 15 feet to sensor very well, picking up people. Cars pretty well @ 20-30 ft. Understanding how infra-red works in detection, will explain why SOME cars or people do not get picked up as well. Tested carrying receiver with me, aimed at remote. This unit does not cover all my needs, so buying different brands, too. If you need to detect a car passing close by it, it works very well, depending on if receiver can receive it from whatever its' location. People at shorter distances than with warmer objects, like cars. High sound is very loud & low is still too loud, so need to cover speaker a bit, FOR ME. Battery life ok. Weather resistant, a little. There is no way to TURN OFF the sound OR muffle it enough ! NOT testing distance on it, receiver to remote, as there are too many variables in the set up. The inside receiver does pick up quite well for me, with remote outside 20 feet away, not aimed at it directly. As good as any similar brand, but system works rather well, in general.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: We have a long driveway and a side-facing garage, so we never know when someone arrives at our house. I put the sensor near the top of the driveway, and the chime perfectly announces when someone arrives. This system is easy to use and has two volumes for the chimes - and you can turn it off when you go away to save the battery. A word of warning: Place the sensor the suggested distance above the ground or it will go off every time a squirrel walks by!

Reviews.Title: Test your luck
Reviews.Author: Jared A. Ross
Reviews.Content: I bought this item because I had one a long time ago.. and it's handy. However, this set did not function properly. The motion sensor wouldn't sense any kind of movement, at all. I changed the batteries in both units, I even bought new batteries to make sure. No luck, the sensor wouldn't do anything. So I guess my warning- beware of lemons. I loved the one I had forever ago, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: SUSAN RAMPERSAD
Reviews.Content: This driveway alert system works great! I placed it near my car and it alerts me if someone is approaching the car. I have had some false alarms, for example if a bat or some animals pass across, the alarms goes off. However, it gives me some piece of mind at night time knowing my car is safe. The alarm also has an high/low button so you can adjust the loudness of the alarm. The alarm and receiver are both wireless and the signal pass through doors, windows, walls etc. You will need to purchase three C batteries and one 9 volt battery for this system. This is a great buy for someone like me who does not have the money to buy an expensive unit. Nonetheless, it works great!

Reviews.Title: Isn't worth the money
Reviews.Author: Jane P. "Jane"
Reviews.Content: I ordered it for our driveway and it worked for a couple of weeks and then it quit.  We replaced the batteries and it then went off all the time for no reason.  We had to finally shut it off because it was so annoying.

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Deb E.
Reviews.Content: But its not waterproof which is where I need it. I made a little housing out of a gallon milk jug to put in on the gate post. Works

Reviews.Title: Excellent Option for Teen Security
Reviews.Author: Joey K. Athon "G. Athon"
Reviews.Content: I didn't purchase this as a driveway alert, I ordered 3 of them to mount at the doors of my home because of a teen who was sneaking out!  I can't afford the home alarm system because they all want contracts for 2-3 years with monthly fees.  I didn't want the door alarms that squeal every time the door is opened (we have pets, etc), plus the alarm is generally at the door and my bedroom is far from one of the three doors in my house.  Other door alarms with receivers didn't have good ratings and didn't have much range.  I mounted one of these at each door and I keep the receivers in my bedroom.  Each night I turn them on and sync each alarm with a receiver, then I shut them off in the morning.  They work great and the sneaking out has been stopped!  There are occasional false alarms - I haven't figured out yet what may be setting them off, but there is no way someone can even open a door to my home without me knowing, let alone walk through it.  Even on low it is very loud, and chimes a dual-note four times.  Very happy with results, and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and effective
Reviews.Author: Debbie L.
Reviews.Content: This product is a great protective device to alert you to anyone near your house. Yes, it will beep when the postal carrier arrives if you have it stationed in front of your home, but only you can hear it inside. Or stick it the garage or a shed, you will hear the chime in the house. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: ross kessler
Reviews.Content: This is a piece of garbage. Does not work as described. Alarm goes of for everything except cars coming down the driveway. Stay away from this item

Reviews.Title: Less than expected
Reviews.Author: Tom C. Harrison
Reviews.Content: The unit did not work@100 feet. Had to almost be on top of it for alarm to go off .

Reviews.Title: Not reliable!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I have had this displayed for 3 days and find it only works some of the time.  I have tested it in several different locations and find it makes no difference.  I can walk past the sensor 10 times and it might ring 4 times.  Don't understand why it works sometimes but not others as my movement past is the same each time.  When cars come into the drive it works sometimes and others no warning at all.  Checked batteries and they are new and working fine.Think I will be returning this product.  Felt I had researched it well and got one that got good reviews on Amazon but for some reason I guess I got a lemon!

Reviews.Title: We use it as a doorbell
Reviews.Author: Henry Becker
Reviews.Content: It works well. We primarily use it so that we know when the dogs are at the door. Ours is protected by a porch, but the directions say to protect it from the weather. I don't think that would be very handy if it was in the driveway.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Gene "skelator"
Reviews.Content: Works great for our officeLike the choice of volume  ,good value for moneyJust get some batterys and your ready to go

Reviews.Title: Great for Gradmothers
Reviews.Author: Anita Sue "Sue"
Reviews.Content: I use this to alert me when the grandchildren leave their room..  I place the signal where they can't see it and it shoots a beam across the door.  Bingo!  If they get up in the night I know it.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Worthless Product
Reviews.Author: Wende
Reviews.Content: I was totally disappointed with this driveway alert.  It didn't go off most of the time.  I would not recommend this product.  It is totally worthless.  I would have returned it but it wasn't worth the postage to send it back.

Reviews.Title: didn't work
Reviews.Author: Billie J. Sizemore
Reviews.Content: The Driveway Alert System did not work. It wouldn't make any noise at all. I would not reorder it. thank you

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert System
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What a surprise - a device that works exactly as advertised and works extremely well at that! I was concerned about false alarms but I'm not now. This alarm works great. I was particulaly impressed with the area it covers. I was concerned it would have a very wide angle of detection making it hard to place. Instead, it seems to have a spread of only about 5' at a distance of 20' very efficient and effective. Great product - we'll seehow well it holds up over time.

Reviews.Title: Works well to alert me that someone's in the driveway
Reviews.Author: Mary G. Hershey
Reviews.Content: I use this to let us know when carpool is here! As other reviewers noted, you will get some false signals from squirrels, etc, but position it well and you'll minimize that. Handling rain, etc. very well.

Reviews.Title: Alarm
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This device exceeded expectations. The volume has two settings and the range of detection is more than enough for my use. The battery level is not quickly depleted which is a real plus.

Reviews.Title: Transmitters won't last long
Reviews.Author: rdkeith
Reviews.Content: I've purchased several of these from Harbor Freight over the last few years. The transmitters (the outside units) will not hold up for long, maybe a few months then they stop working.  When the transmitter stops working you will have the replace the whole thing since they both must operate on the same frequency. On the plus side, they work well with good long range. For my part, I want to put the $20 or so needed to purchase another of these into another brand that (hopefully) will hold up longer.

Reviews.Title: Alert
Reviews.Author: Allen Hahm
Reviews.Content: Product works well but no adjustment for mounting(vertical or horizontal).  A delay for the alert after the first would be nice to prevent the alarm going off continuously when something in its range.  A good start that could be a lot better.

Reviews.Title: Good or Bad? You decide!
Reviews.Author: AkBarb
Reviews.Content: I've purchased three of these units from different sellers in past two months.  One worked like a champ, with consistent alerts for almost a month- until it rained.  Despite being under a cover, the motion detector died.  The second unit's motion detector did not work at all, ever, and the third unit, from this seller is still working after two weeks - sort of.  The object has to pass within eight feet, or it doesn't register, and it stopped working for a day or so.  I brought the motion detector inside and it began working again a few hours later, so it's back outside.  Since I use it to detect black bear activity in the yard, it's really important that it works consistently.  If you don't mind spotty functioning, it might work well for you.

Reviews.Title: Worked about 2 ft away from Receiver
Reviews.Author: W. Wright
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these awhile back and it worked reasonably well for maybe 6 mos to 1 yr. (don't really remember).  I figured for the price I can replace it once a year.  The reviews on the more expensive systems (and the cheap systems too) show they work about 50% of the time.  So it's pretty much a crap shoot to get one that actually works. Reviews.Title: Good product-- suggestions to keep dry
Reviews.Author: Recumbent Ron
Reviews.Content: I just bought 3 of these units based on the reviews I've read.  So far I'm pretty happy.  I have a few false alarms, but sensitivity may need to be reduced with some masking tape around the edge of the lens, as I've read.  I also understand that the transmitter isn't very water resistant.  I've though about ways to remedy this and the simplest so far is to take a zip lock sandwich bag and put the transmitter inside.  From tests so far, the sensitivity is unaffected.  Several people have asked about finding additional transmitters.  I ended up with an extra transmitter on the wrong frequency.  I've have a good electrical background so I took the transmitter apart and compared the circuit boards for the one on the correct channel, and the one on the undesired frequency.  There are three very small loops of wire  next to an integrated circuit  on the right hand side of the board and the pattern of clipped loops and intact ones was different.  This combination  apparently determines the  transmitter's channel.  I clipped one loop and soldered another and now the channel of the extra transmitter is the same as the one I wanted to duplicate.  Don't  attempt this surgery if you aren't prepared to ruin the transmitter, or have no electronics experience.  At least in my case  It did provide a way to have duplicate channel transmitters without buying another new transmitter and receiver.  I'll report back how these units hold up after being in the weather a bit.

Reviews.Title: Now I know when my Amazon orders arrive!
Reviews.Author: Brucer
Reviews.Content: Some delivery drivers won't ring the doorbell - or I can't always hear it - when they leave packages at the door so I bought this unit to solve that problem. The receiver has on/off and HI/LO volume switches as well as a red LED bar that lights when triggered. If you're close enough to see the light you'd have to be stone cold deaf not to hear the tone when it's set to HI! It's loud - which is a good thing - so you'll hear it throughout the house and even in the LO setting it's fairly loud.  Installation was just a matter of inserting a 9 volt battery in the outdoor sensor unit and three C cells in the indoor unit (or use your own 6 volt AC adapter). The sensor can be mounted with a single screw wherever convenient, like under an eve. As described in the instructions, don't point the sensor at windows or other reflective surfaces as it will pick up the heat and trigger. In walk testing I found that the unit would "see" me about 20 feet away. The transmit range however, is far less than the 400 feet quoted if things like walls stand between the inside and outside of your home. With a few walls involved figure about 30 feet as more typical. However, as I mentioned earlier, the thing can be heard through the whole house so the range won't an issue unless you're planning on taking the receiver to the basement, backyard or out to the barn. Bunker Hill Security is a Harbor Freight house brand which is where you'll find the best cost.

So I put it on the fireplace while watching tv and our bedroom on nightstand at bedtime and if upstairs take it up there with me. It is set where it will not pick up small cats or dogs. You have to be directly in front of the sensor for it to go off. You can move 10 degrees to the right or left and it will not detect you. It works for us because we only need it to "watch" our cars, as car break-ins occur quite frequently in our neighborhood. However, if you are looking for something a little more foil-proof, I wouldn't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Indoor security
Reviews.Author: Mauricio
Reviews.Content: It was pleased under lamp table next to couch so when the nephews pass the no play zone I'm inform of it

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: tasi
Reviews.Content: item worked exactly as advertised, ha works great indoors and out, item was shipped fast, excellent service, i would buy another one if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: bobj
Reviews.Content: I use the product at our cabin to alert us to oncoming visitors.  It does however go off when the deer or bear roam around the driveway at night. The dog is now sensitized to the sound and jumps up thinking someone is coming to visit. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Bill Jaffe
Reviews.Content: I use this at work to alert me when someone walks in. Works great although is too loud. Even when it's on low. I put tape over the speaker vents but it is still too loud.

Reviews.Title: Works great for my garage.
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Wehe
Reviews.Content: I have two of these deployed in a detached garage about 150 feet from the receiver. So far not one false alarm and just to be sure the devices are working I check them out on a weekly basis.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert System
Reviews.Author: Jean H Pritchett
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for someone else.  She was very pleased that it arrived so soon.  Apparently completely satisfied.  Am not surethat she has had a chance to use it yet.

Reviews.Title: Nice driveway monitor
Reviews.Author: Terry Lee Rambo
Reviews.Content: Has a very loud beep we can hear all over the house and even picks up someone walking up the driveway. The only negative I've found is the bright sunlight sets it off. We need to move it to a shadier spot. That said, I would still recommend it to everyone..

Reviews.Title: It works too good
Reviews.Author: howard kalinsky
Reviews.Content: It just constantly keeps triggering off the buzzer. Can't as yet find the right outside spot that allows it to work properly. The outside sensor detector is so sensitive that almost anything, rain, wind, branches , you name it trips it off. Very annoying! However, the concept is good and the need is important, so I'm still working on trying to find the exact spot for proper operation. Aside from this problem, set up and installation was was easy.

Reviews.Title: We are very happy with this item.
Reviews.Author: Tony Serna
Reviews.Content: I really like it.  it is very easy to install and it looks professional.  We are using it in our wellness clinic.

Reviews.Title: Sensor spread is too wide!
Reviews.Author: Tony - OKC
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a single line sensor, but it's not.  It seems as it's a 90 degree sensor (although it's probably lower) and has been quit annoying with such a large spread.  It got to the point that we started to ignore the annoying THREE BEEP system.  Yes, three beeps!  Why is there not an option to switch it a single beep?!?!?  I digress, I eventually had to plant the sensor into the ground to help lower the sensor and to help disguise the unit.  Unfortunately, the unit is a bright white unit, which stands out on a driveway.  I had to take a black sharpie to the unit so it wouldn't be so obvious that I have a driveway alert system.  Of course, with the three long beeps, the person walking up can hear the last beep as they get close to the door.  Great price, but a lot of flaws.Oh yeah, the range is great.  The receiver is on the second floor and receives the signal without a problem.  The price and the range is why I give 3 out 5 instead of only 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Ted Santos "doowopted"
Reviews.Content: My house has an alarm on it but I needed some protection from the rear. So I have it in my sun porch pointing out the back and if someone comes up to the back it will alert me in time to get my gun.

Reviews.Title: Does What I Want
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: This driveway alarm works well for a reasonable price. I am so glad i read the reviews and bought it. The $21 pricetag is just right.

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: RSC
Reviews.Content: This item arrived today and we installed it promptly.  It has already alerted us to a vehicle pulling into our driveway.  The low volume on the indoor speaker is very low (& we're not hearing impaired).  For us, the volume is perfect on the high setting.

Reviews.Title: Two months. Then trash.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Benjamin Redding III "420ben420"
Reviews.Content: The product worked great for about two months. It stopped working. I replaced the batteries in both units. It still does not work. Buy a better quality product if you expect it to last.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money, work like a charm.
Reviews.Author: Remo Williams
Reviews.Content: Easy to mount and works like a charm. This is a good value for the money. will buy another for the back yard.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ramona
Reviews.Content: It's doing everything we bought it to do....working great. We did put it in a birdhouse but it's picking up as it should.  We certainly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good alert system
Reviews.Author: K. Paris
Reviews.Content: It works well but sometimes it is too sensitive and goes off if a bird flies by.  Better to be too sensitive than not sensitive enough.  Fast shipment.

Reviews.Title: so far it is a great alarm.
Reviews.Author: USNretired "USNretired"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to moniter my blind driveway.  It has worker great so far.  Am disappointed that it is not waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Silver Crow "Yes i know...but do i understand?"
Reviews.Content: I have used this device for a week now and am satisfied with it.It used 5 C cell batteries and 1 9V battery and the batteries case requires a tiny screwdriver.. which is a little odd.I taped up the seam on the outside unit and have had no problem with rain. False detections are low to nonexistent even when the wind starts picking up.It has a 40 degree detection angle and i think that is a little small but it still works.

Reviews.Title: Works great for our needs
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: First off, but no big deal, the description says 1 9-volt and 3 C batteries.  When I received it it actually took 3 AAA and 3 C batteries, but again, not a big deal since I did not buy batteries for it yet.  We use this at work.  We have a large warehouse in the back and when you are working back there and machines are running, you cannot hear if someone comes in the front door.  We have the ringer positioned in the middle of the building and you can hear it over the machines.  We previously had a different brand which didn't last all that long.  This one seems like it will hold up for the long haul.  If it ever goes out, we'll be buying another one.

Reviews.Title: I use it as a basement stairs alert
Reviews.Author: Harley B. Rider
Reviews.Content: My shop is in a corner of my basement and it is aggravating and unsafe when someone comes up behind me when I'm working with a power saw, or some other loud tool, so I mounted the sensor at the top of the basement stairs and the receiver in my shop. The loud setting is clearly audible over the table or radial saw, and the quiet setting is perfect when no tools are running and I'm planing a project. I would have liked a sound setting between the two and would have given it 5 stars if it had more variable volume.

Reviews.Title: Works Great, good range
Reviews.Author: 1fauxhawk1
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly for security from backyard fence being opened and side yard intruders. I bought two and they worked well. I think the only small issue was that  it has two options for volume, its a little loud even on the lowest setting. Overal it does its duty and it seems to be fine for now.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the long driveway
Reviews.Author: D. Owen
Reviews.Content: We have a very long (75ft) driveway.  I like to know when people are coming to the front door.  This little alarm does the trick.  Once the alarm goes off, my dogs start barking.  The solicitors usually don't even bother coming to front door because they hear the dogs and make that u-turn. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: Works Maybe Too Good
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The units I bought are working too good, they pick up small animals, even though I have it about 4 foot off the ground, so at times it's going off when a cat or dog goes by.  I placed the other unit in my garage, no problems there and gives me piece of mind at night.  Units work great, if you want to know what goes by all the time, I thinks if you want  security in a confined area, this is it.  Driveways no so much.  Unable to adjust sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: miguebu
Reviews.Content: The product works very well. I bought it to use when I go camping. I warned of the presence of animals and people near the camp. It would be nice if it were possible to buy additional sensors, needing two and bought two products, now I have two sensors and two receivers, when you only need a receiver, both sensors transmit on the same frequency.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: wlh
Reviews.Content: I have had this driveway alarm for about a month and it is working great so far. I would definitely recommend this alarm.

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen McKay
Reviews.Content: The sensor picks up blowing leaves , so I've had to turn it off several times when windy, defeating the purpose.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor range- no adjustment
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: The range is poor. I would say 80 feet line of sight, MAX. Though a wall you will be lucky to get 40 feet. This is supposed to be a driveway monitor- if you use it as a driveway monitor, you'd better have a 40 foot driveway. Mine is 73 feet and it's out of range. Period.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert System
Reviews.Author: Lillie M. Yancey "nurseyancey"
Reviews.Content: The price was ok, and it shipped fast. Looks good, but did not work. It never detected any motion. We changed the batteries three times, thinking it must be the batteries. Not so. So I returned at sellers expense.

Reviews.Title: good product, great price
Reviews.Author: Lew Schuerkamp
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and works fine for my purpose.  I have 100ft. driveway.  received product quickly and undamaged.  product works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: This product is great!
Reviews.Author: retrat
Reviews.Content: We live on a main street and get a lot of weirdo's walking by so it is nice to have this to alert us if people step onto our property so we can see who it is.

Reviews.Title: driveway alert order
Reviews.Author: Al McLane
Reviews.Content: received only half my order, undercounter light not received.please check with vendor and complete my order. driveway alarm is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: S. Kensinger "warrior"
Reviews.Content: Everyone likes to come in the back door, problem is.. .we never know when someone is coming. We bought a driveway alarm but that is only for car traffic. this allows us to know if someone is walking down to the house. Very easy installation too!

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert
Reviews.Author: Marilyn J. Moore "Mammy Jo"
Reviews.Content: It works great. I would buy this again if necessary. and recommend it to my friends. I should have bought another one while I was in the process.

Reviews.Title: GOOD AS IT GETS.
Reviews.Author: STRONG BOY
Reviews.Content: LOVED THIS PRODUCT AND IT WORKS REAL WELL RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX. PUT BATTIRES IN IT AND ITS GOOD TO GO. WOULD RECOMEND THIS TO ANY ONE FOR A SECURITY SYSTEM FOR IN YOUR DRIVE WAY OR WERE EVER. I LIKE THAT U CAN USE IT ON LOUD AND NOT SO LOUD AND IT WAS A GOOD PRICE,

Reviews.Title: Brings peace of mind
Reviews.Author: Bea
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product after our neighbor's home was broken into and the criminals parked in our driveway unnoticed. Now any time someone walks up our driveway or drives their car our alarm system beeps. It's easy to install and easy to control the volume. We feel much safer with this product.

Reviews.Title: driveway alert
Reviews.Author: Gail Holcombe
Reviews.Content: We live in the country and cannot see if a car is approaching on our driveway. This item solved that problem perfectly and with the adjustable sound, it is quite handy!

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I bought this for indoor night motion detecting and have not used it outdoors.It does exactly what I wanted and I have two detectors signaling one receiver.The alarm works on low or high volume setting and is loud enough to hear just about anywhere in the house. It does the job.I can't say how well it would work outdoors, exposed to rain or snow.

Reviews.Title: Driveway Alert System
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this driveway alarm for my wife's store so when someone goes up or down stairs she can keep an eye on them.  Works really well.  Highly recommend product.

Reviews.Title: Great alerting system
Reviews.Author: Sharina
Reviews.Content: I use this in my medical office.  I have the transmitter nailed to the front door and have the receiver near my patient office door so I can hear when someone comes in the door when my fans are going.  I like having the ability to turn off the receiver and also I use the low setting. It has a nice bing bong sound. The receiver is portable.  My office is in my house so I can take it with me if I am in another part of the house while waiting for my next patient.  It works really well.  I am really happy I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great People notifier
Reviews.Author: Ernie "Engineman (USN)"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on amazon and it works great.I place this Item about 20 feet away from our front door so I will be notified If someone is their.

Reviews.Title: GREAT product!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I replaced another brand with this item. It works perfectly. The other would set off the alarm, when there was no reason. It became quite annoying. I would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Driveway alarm system
Reviews.Author: jane
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful way to alert you to someone entering your property.  Only thing we didn't like was that it has to be closer than the 200' that it claims.  When it was at about 180' the alarm would not sound in the house unless the window was open.

Reviews.Title: Great help in caring for dementia patient
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Burtscher
Reviews.Content: We are using this in our home mainly at night to alert us when my mother, who has dementia, leaves her room. We tried a more expensive system, but it was very complicated & we were never able to get it to work.  I don't know how long this will work, but for the price, we can replace as needed.  It is very simple to use; install batteries & place the motion sensor & portable base unit wherever you need it.  I love that it's portable & so very easy to use.  During the day I can move it to whatever room I'm working in & receive an alert when Mom gets up from her nap.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Nice inexpensive system
Reviews.Author: gadget guy
Reviews.Content: I did an extensive video review at youtube. Search for my channel dfizzbom, or if they let me keep this link in, it can be found here[...]I think this inexpensive two piece system works great!

Reviews.Title: 6 volt adapter
Reviews.Author: Drillnow
Reviews.Content: Bunker Hill Security driveway alert system.  Looking for the optional 6 volt mA power adapter as described in the Bunker Hill instruction booklet. Why is there no place to buy this adapter?? Why put it in the instructions with no place to purchase it????

Reviews.Title: so far not so good
Reviews.Author: scootz
Reviews.Content: *****my initial review was favorable.  however approx 6 months later, some inconsistent signals.  changed batteries and worked fine for about 1 month.  moved the sensor closer to the house, nothing.  so from the date of purchase till now, less than one year ABSOLUTELY NADA!!!  therefore, i cannot recommend this item to anyone

Reviews.Title: did not work
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Moyer
Reviews.Content: it came in a timely manner but did not work this was a gift, still have not heard any information on the return and would like to know

Reviews.Title: Great if used sensibly
Reviews.Author: Phoenixx
Reviews.Content: This motion detector works great for my purposes.  Just needed to know when destructive armadillos and other night animals were coming around my front yard, flower beds and hen yard.  Like the reviewer says: "..you just have to be smarter than the box it comes in.."  You certainly can't place this near an area where there is a lot of movement, either from shrubs or weeds in the wind, or ordinary traffic.  I put mine in a plastic gallon milk jug with the side cut out, so it only detects the area right in front  - and set it too face in the direction I expect the night animals will approach.  No need to mount it permanently; I just move it around to find the right place to catch the villains. The alarm is just loud enough to awaken me, and I've seldom had false alerts. Much easier than trying to use a motion-detector video setup that has to be hooked up to the computer.  Highly recommend, if it's used sensibly.

Reviews.Title: Visitor warning system
Reviews.Author: Ralph L Alexander
Reviews.Content: It works very well. Far better than one I bought from Lowes at 3 times the cost and had to return.  I would have given it a 5 if their customer service was better.  I bought one last year and set it up in my driveway with the chime in the kitchen.  I wanted the new for the rear gate and the chime in the rec room.  My hope was they would both signal both places so regardless of where we were in the house, we would hear "visitors" from either place.  Wrong.  I called about how to make it work that way or how to buy a matched pair and they couldn't understand what I wanted.  All they could tell me was how to buy more. And the frequency can't be adjusted as you would in most electronic devices like a garage door opener, etc.

Reviews.Title: Where Can I Buy Extra Sensors For This Product?
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these units and it works fine.The only thing I would like to know is where can I buy extra sensors for this product?I bought mine @ Harbor Freight and it was only $17.99 but I would like to but a couplemore sensors and Harbor Freight don't sell them.I called them and they had no way to buy extra sensors for this unit.I guess they are just like all the other companies out there, don't offer customers a way to buy extrasensors, when you can make them order another whole complete unit.The oil companies taught all the other companies how to scam and fleece people out of more money.I looked on the Internet and I cant fine anyone who sells extra sensors for this Bunker Hillproduct.Anyone have an idea where to buy more sensors for the Driveway Alert System?Now I said sensors not receivers.I would appreciate any help anyone has to offer offer.Thanks - Larry

Reviews.Title: Range varies from 10' to 40' depending on the units mood!
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: It's OK fro the price but you get what you pay for, it has a range of about 40' but dosen't alwayswork within that range. I can be 10' away and I have to sometimes keep moving around for it to soundthe alarm. I installed it in a shaded area and lined up up with in 10' to the end of the driveway. Far from 100%but for the price I'll keep it even if it only senses within 10' , it will let me know at least someone is coming to the front door.Expected more after they other reviews.

Reviews.Title: Alert system is so sensitive, it  picks up the neighbor's driveway traffic
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure this would work because it was priced so low.It works so well, it was alerting us when cars drove in the neighbor's driveway.We moved the sensor to the opposite side of our driveway, aimed toward avacant lot.

Reviews.Title: Disturbingly LOUD!
Reviews.Author: California Girl - LMD
Reviews.Content: This item went under another name in 2010 called Western Safety.  We never could really try it well, as it is so LOUD, even set on LO.  The sound upset our Beagle, of course more than us, having more sensitive ears, so we aborted the idea, thus over the years, have had to live with "surprise" visitors from time to time.I'm now searching for a less alarming alert system.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Gregory Berkin
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this is a $20+ paperweight.  Don't listen to the reviews, they are full of sh*!Just so we are on the same page, you take the components out of the packing, install the batteries, and then turn on the device.  There is no adjusting.  Period.I get about 30 feet of range before this junk box stops responding.  Interference?  I don't think that we can consider air to be something that causes interference so it's plain and simple; don't buy this.
